segments.text: Have you adapted to the lifestyle in China ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , almost . But there is one thing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I still wonder what privacy meant for Chinese people . I don't mean to say that there's no privacy in China , but ...
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Some of my Chinese colleagues just share their personal stories in front of others .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah . we never do that in a public office .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Perhaps that's because we hold different ideas about privacy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I have felt that . One day when i was in a queue , reading a newspaper story , the man behind me peered through my shoulder and stared at the newspaper I was holding .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , that's not rare . I've seen people reading at others ' newspaper while taking a metro or a bus .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just stare at the newspaper holding in the hands of the one next to him ?
segments.speaker: S2
